tprstats.fit_distribution

Module Contents

tprstats.fit_distribution.DISTRIBUTIONS = ['norm', 'uniform', 't', 'skewnorm']
tprstats.fit_distribution.POSITIVE_ONLY_DISTRIBUTIONS = ['weibull_min', 'gamma', 'lognorm', 'expon']
tprstats.fit_distribution.calculate_aic(distribution: str, data)[source]

Calculate the Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) given a valid scipy.stats distribution namestring.

Parameters:

  • distribution (str) – The name of the distribution. Must be a solution from the package scipy.stats.

  • data (pandas.DataFrame) – The data.

Returns:

AIC for the given distribution and data.

Return type:

float

tprstats.fit_distribution.list_aic(data)[source]

List AICs for the included distributions. Included distributions: normal, uniform, t, skew normal, weibull, gamma, log-normal and exponentional.

Parameters:

data (pandas.DataFrame) – The data.

Returns:

The AIC values calculated for the included distributions with respect to the data.

Return type:

pandas.Series

tprstats.fit_distribution.select_distribution(data)[source]

Fits up to 8 different distributions to a set of data and recommends the best-fitting distribution, where best-fitting is considered to be the distribution with the smallest Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) value. Included distributions: normal, uniform, t, skew normal, weibull, gamma, log-normal and exponentional.

Parameters:

data (pandas.DataFrame) – The data.

Returns:

The name of the best-fitting distribution, i.e., the distribution with the lowest AIC.

Return type:

str
